Class Pairs

Pairs are list of pairs (name,values) quite similar to dictionaries, excepted that there can be multiple values for a single key, and that the order of the keys is preserved. They can be easily converted to URL parameters, headers and cookies.

Method __init__

__init__( self )
Undocumented

Method apply

apply( self, request )
Undocumented

Class Personality

Personality classes allow to represent the way a specific application (typically a browser) interacts with a web server. Some servers do check for specific headers and will react differently depending on wether they recognize the request as being part of a browser or not.

Personalities allow to ensure that specific headers are set in all requests, so that the requests really look like they come from a specific browser.

Method attach

Method attachments

attachments( self )

Returns the list of attachments for this request (as a list of triples, as explained in makeAttachment).

Returns the cookies defined in this request, as a Pair instance (if any).

Method data

Sets the urlencoded data for this request. The request will be automatically turned into a post.

Method fields

fields( self )

Returns the fields of this request, as a Pair instance (if any). fields are related to form-submission (see also data method).

Returns the method for this request

Method url

Returns this request url, including the parameters

Function makeAttachment

makeAttachment( name, filename=None, content=None, mimetype='text/plain' )

Creates an internal representation for an attachment, which is either the given filename or the given content, filename and data, as a triple:

 (<content name>,   <content value>, CONTENT_ATTACHMENT)
 (<file name from>, <actual file name>, FILE_ATTACHMENT)

Here CONTENT_ATTACHMENT and FILE_ATTACHMENT are constants from the wwwclient module to denote the type of attachment.

Class Request

The Request object encapsulates an HTTP request so that it is easy to specify headers, cookies, data and attachments.

Method dump

dump( self, path, data=None, overwrite=True )

Dumps the last retrieved data to the given file.

Method ensure

ensure( self, expects, action, args=(), kwargs={}, retry=None, delay=None )

Ensures that the given action (it should be a session instance method), executed with the given args complies with the expect predicate, which will be given his session. You can specify a number of retries (maxed to 10), and a delay (in seconds) before each retry.

When finished, this function returns True if it suceeded, or False if the retries failed.

Method form

form( self, name=None )

Returns the first form declared in the last transaction response data.

Method forms

forms( self, name=None )

Returns a dictionary with the forms contained in the response.

Method get

get( self, url='/', params=None, headers=None, follow=None, do=None, cookies=None )

Gets the page at the given URL, with the optional params (as a Pair instance), with the given headers.

The follow and do options tell if redirects should be followed and if the request should be sent right away.

This returns a Transaction object, which is done if the do parameter is true.

Method last

last( self )

Returns the last transaction of the session, or None if there is not transaction in the session.

Method links

links( self )

Returns a list of the links contained in the response.

Method page

page( self )

Returns the data of the last page. This is an alias for self.last().data().

Method personality

personality( self )

Returns the personality bound to this session.

Method post

post( self, url=None, params=None, data=None, mimetype=None, fields=None, attach=None, headers=None, follow=None, do=None, cookies=None )

Posts data to the given URL. The optional params (Pairs) or data contain the posted data. The mimetype describes the mimetype of the data (if it is a special kind of data). The fields is a Pairs instance of values to be encoded within the body. The attach may contain some attachements created before using the attach() method.

You should have a look at the wwwclient.client module for more information on how the parameters are processed.

As always, this returns a new Transaction instance.

Method referer

referer( self, value= )

Returns/sets the referer for the next request.

Method savePage

savePage( self, path, transaction=None )

Saves the page from the given transaction (default it last()) to the given file.

Method setLogger

setLogger( self, callback )

Sets the logger callback (only enabled when the session is set to verbose

Method setPersonality

setPersonality( self, personality )
Undocumented

Method status

status( self )

Returns the status of the last transaction. This is an alias for self.last().status()

Method submit

submit( self, form, values={}, attach=[], action=None, method='POST', do=None, cookies=None, strip=True )

Submits the given form with the current values and action (first action by default) to the form action url, and doing a POST or GET with the resulting values (POST by default).

The submit method is a convenience wrapper that processes the given form and gives its values as parameters to the post method.

Method url

url( self )

Returns the URL of the last page. This is an alias for self.last().url()

Method verbose

verbose( self, status=None )

Returns the verbose status if no argument is given, ortherwise takes a boolean that will define the verbose status.

int

int(x, base) -> integer

Convert a string or number to an integer, if possible. A floating point argument will be truncated towards zero (this does not include a string representation of a floating point number!) When converting a string, use the optional base. It is an error to supply a base when converting a non-string. If the argument is outside the integer range a long object will be returned instead.

Convert a string or number to an integer, if possible. A floating point argument will be truncated towards zero (this does not include a string representation of a floating point number!) When converting a string, use the optional base. It is an error to supply a base when converting a non-string. If the argument is outside the integer range a long object will be returned instead.

Class Session

A Session encapsulates a number of transactions (couples of request and responses). The session stores common state (the cookies), that is shared by the different transactions. Each session has a maximum number of transaction which is given by its @maxTransactions attribute.

Attributes
  • host: Session host (by name or IP)
  • protocol: Session protocol (either HTTP or HTTPS)
  • transactions: List of transactions
  • maxTransactions: Maximum number of transactions in registered in this session
  • cookies: List of cookies for this session
  • userAgent: String for this user session agent

Class Transaction

A transaction encaspulates a request and its (zero or more) responses.

Attributes
  • session: enclosing session
  • request: request
  • data: data
  • cookies: cookies
  • redirect: for the redirection (None by default)
  • done: if the transaction was executed or not

When converting a string, use the optional base. It is an error to supply a base when converting a non-string. If the argument is outside the integer range a long object will be returned instead.

Class TagTree

A tree node wraps one or two tags and allows to structure tags as a tree. The tree node instance offers a nice interface to manipulate the HTML document as a tree.

Module scrape

The scraping module gives a set of functionalities to manipulate HTML data. All functions are text oriented, so that they work with any subset of an HTML document. This is very useful, as it does not require the HTML to be well-formed, and allows easy selection of HTML fragments.

Method __init__

__init__( self, name, action=None )

Method _addInput

_addInput( self, inputDict )

Private function used by the parseForms function to add an input to this form. The input will be added to the inputs list and to the _fields dict.

Method _prefill

_prefill( self )

Sets the default values for this form.

Method actions

actions( self, namelike=None, namesOnly=False )

Returns the list of inputs (or input names if namesOnly is True) that correspond to form action buttons.

Method asText

asText( self )

Returns a pretty-printed text representation of this form. This representation is very useful when it comes to analysing web pages.

Method clear

clear( self )

Clears the existing values set in this form, and returns them.

Method field

field( self, name, caseSenstitive=True )

Returns the field with the given name, or None if it does not exist.

Method fieldNames

fieldNames( self )

Alias to fields(nameOnly=True). Returns the name of the fields of this form.

Method fields

fields( self, namelike=None, namesOnly=False )

Returns that list of inputs (or input names if namesOnly is True) that can be assigned a value (checkboxes, inputs, text areas, etc).

Method fill

fill( self, **values )

Fills this form with the given values.

Method parameters

parameters( self )

Returns a list of (key,value) respecting the original input order.

Method set

set( self, name, value )

Sets the given form value. This modified the values within the form, and not the fields directly.

Method submit

submit( self, action=None, encoding='latin-1', strip=True, **values )

Submits this form with the given action and given values. This basically takes all the default values set within this form, replacing them with the set or given values (given as keywords), and returns a list of (key, value) pairs that represent the parameters that should be encoded in the response.

In this repsect, the submit method does not do the actual submission, but rather prepares the data for submission.

Also, note that submission does not mutate the form, it simply creates a list of parameters suitable for creating the body of a post request.

Method unset

unset( self, name )

This unsets the given value from this form values. The effect will be that that the named input default value will be used instead of a user-provided one.

Class Form

A simple interface to forms, returned by the scraper. Forms can be easily filled and their values (@values) can be given as parameters to the @browse module.

A form has:

  • a single action
  • a list of inputs which are dicts of equivalent HTML element attributes. For elements such as select or textarea, the input type property is set to the actual element type.
  • a list of values which will be associated with values when filling the form.

Form values are cleanly separated from their inputs, so that you can simply clear the values to resubmit the form.

Class FormException

Undocumented

Function parseForms

parseForms( scraper, html )

Will extract the forms from the HTML document in a way that tolerates inputs outside of forms (this happens sometime). This function is very fast, because it only uses regexes to search for tags within the document, so there is no need to parse the HTML.

Currently form inputs, select and option are supported.

SRE_Pattern

Compiled regular expression objects

Module form

Undocumented

Method GET

GET( self, url, headers=None )

Gets the given URL, setting the given headers (as a list of strings).

Method POST

POST( self, url, data=None, mimetype=None, fields=None, attach=None, headers=None )

Posts the given data (as urlencoded string), or fields as list of (name, value) pairs and/or attachments as list of (name, value, type) triples. Headers attributes are the same as for the @GET method.

The @attach parameter is quite special, as the value will depend on the type: if type is @FILEATTACHMENT, then value is simply the path to the file, but if the type is @CONTENTATTACHMENT, the value is expected to be a triple (filename, mimetype, value).

Method __init__

__init__( self, encoding='latin-1' )

Creates a new HTTPClient with the given encoding as default encofing (latin-1 is the default).

Method _absoluteURL

_absoluteURL( self, url )

Returns the absolute URL for the given url

Method _ensureAttachment

Ensures that the given attachment is a list of attachments. For instance if attach is a single attachment, it will be returned as [attach].

Method _parseHeaders

Parses all headers and returns a list of (key, value) representing them.

Method _parseResponse

_parseResponse( self, message )

Parse the message, and return a list of responses and headers. This might occur when there is a provisional response in between, or when location are followed. The result is a list of (firstline, headers, body), all as unparsed stings.

Method _parseStatefulHeaders

_parseStatefulHeaders( self, headers )

Return the Location and Set-Cookie headers from the given header string.

Method _valueToPostData

_valueToPostData( self, value )

Encodes the given value as an url-encoded string suitable for post-data. If the value is a string, it will be left as-s (only converted to the default encoding)

Method _valueToString

_valueToString( self, value )

Ensures that the given value will be an encoded string, encoded in this HTTPClient default encoding (set it with the @encoding attribute).

data( self )

Returns the last response data.

dataSize( self )

Returns the total size of the responses.

encode( self, fields=(), attach=() )

Encodes the given fields and attachments (as given to POST) and returns the request body and content type for sending the encoded data. This method can be used to bypass Curl own form encoding techniques.

Class HTTPClient

Abstract class for an HTTPClient. As explained in the module documentation, the HTTPClient is a an object-oriented interface to low-level HTTP communication infrastructure. The HTTPClient is stateful, in the sense that it aggregates the status resulting from requests and responses.

Module client

This modules defines an abstract class for HTTP clients, that creates a simple, easy to understand, low-level wrapper for existing HTTP implementation. It expects to have simple datatypes as input for building the request, and expects to have the response a string.

The HTTPClient class has a fast response parser that is able to update important information withing the client.

HTTPClient subclasses are instanciated and bound to every session. As HTTPClient are stateful (they aggregate session state), they are not meant to be shared among different sessions.

tuple

(<class client.HTTPClient at 0x946986c>,)

tuple() -> an empty tuple tuple(sequence) -> tuple initialized from sequence's items

If the argument is a tuple, the return value is the same object.

Class Contract

A contract is like a unit test case, but for a website. Each contract has its own browsing session and scraping tools, which can be used by the various test methods.

Class ContractError

Undocumented

Function depends

depends( *names )

Decorates a contract test method, telling that it depends on a particular resource.

Function provides

provides( *names )

Decorates a contract test method, telling that it provides a particular resource, that may be required by another test.

Module contracts

The contract module allows to express simple test case that allow to check particular responses. This enables easy verification of an API, as well as detection of modfications of an existing website API.

Method post

post( self, url=None, params=None, data=None, mimetype=None, fields=None, attach=None, headers=None, follow=None, do=None, cookies=None )

Posts data to the given URL. The optional params (Pairs) or data contain the posted data. The mimetype describes the mimetype of the data (if it is a special kind of data). The fields is a Pairs instance of values to be encoded within the body. The attach may contain some attachements created before using the attach() method.

You should have a look at the wwwclient.client module for more information on how the parameters are processed.

As always, this returns a new Transaction instance.

Module client

This modules defines an abstract class for HTTP clients, that creates a simple, easy to understand, low-level wrapper for existing HTTP implementation. It expects to have simple datatypes as input for building the request, and expects to have the response a string.

The HTTPClient class has a fast response parser that is able to update important information withing the client.

HTTPClient subclasses are instanciated and bound to every session. As HTTPClient are stateful (they aggregate session state), they are not meant to be shared among different sessions.

Class HTMLTools

This class contains a set of tools to process HTML text data easily. This class can operate on a full HTML document, or on any subset of the document.

Function parseForms

parseForms( scraper, html )

Will extract the forms from the HTML document in a way that tolerates inputs outside of forms (this happens sometime). This function is very fast, because it only uses regexes to search for tags within the document, so there is no need to parse the HTML.

Currently form inputs, select and option are supported.

Method get

get( self, url='/', params=None, headers=None, follow=None, do=None, cookies=None )

Gets the page at the given URL, with the optional params (as a Pair instance), with the given headers.

The follow and do options tell if redirects should be followed and if the request should be sent right away.

This returns a Transaction object, which is done if the do parameter is true.

Method ensure

ensure( self, expects, action, args=(), kwargs={}, retry=None, delay=None )

Ensures that the given action (it should be a session instance method), executed with the given args complies with the expect predicate, which will be given his session. You can specify a number of retries (maxed to 10), and a delay (in seconds) before each retry.

When finished, this function returns True if it suceeded, or False if the retries failed.

This attachment can be used later by giving it as value for the attach parameter of the post method.

Function makeAttachment

makeAttachment( name, filename=None, content=None, mimetype='text/plain' )

Creates an internal representation for an attachment, which is either the given filename or the given content, filename and data, as a triple:

 (<content name>,   <content value>, CONTENT_ATTACHMENT)
 (<file name from>, <actual file name>, FILE_ATTACHMENT)

Here CONTENT_ATTACHMENT and FILE_ATTACHMENT are constants from the wwwclient module to denote the type of attachment.

Class Session

A Session encapsulates a number of transactions (couples of request and responses). The session stores common state (the cookies), that is shared by the different transactions. Each session has a maximum number of transaction which is given by its @maxTransactions attribute.

Attributes
  • host: Session host (by name or IP)
  • protocol: Session protocol (either HTTP or HTTPS)
  • transactions: List of transactions
  • maxTransactions: Maximum number of transactions in registered in this session
  • cookies: List of cookies for this session
  • userAgent: String for this user session agent

Method attach

attach( self, name, filename=None, content=None, mimetype=None )

Attach the given file or content to the request. This will turn the request into a post

Method attachments

attachments( self )

Returns the list of attachments for this request (as a list of triples, as explained in makeAttachment).

Class Personality

Personality classes allow to represent the way a specific application (typically a browser) interacts with a web server. Some servers do check for specific headers and will react differently depending on wether they recognize the request as being part of a browser or not.

Personalities allow to ensure that specific headers are set in all requests, so that the requests really look like they come from a specific browser.

Class Pairs

Pairs are list of pairs (name,values) quite similar to dictionaries, excepted that there can be multiple values for a single key, and that the order of the keys is preserved. They can be easily converted to URL parameters, headers and cookies.

int

int(x, base) -> integer

Convert a string or number to an integer, if possible. A floating point argument will be truncated towards zero (this does not include a string representation of a floating point number!) When converting a string, use the optional base. It is an error to supply a base when converting a non-string. If the argument is outside the integer range a long object will be returned instead.

newCookies( self )

Method submit

submit( self, action=None, encoding='latin-1', strip=True, **values )

Submits this form with the given action and given values. This basically takes all the default values set within this form, replacing them with the set or given values (given as keywords), and returns a list of (key, value) pairs that represent the parameters that should be encoded in the response.

In this repsect, the submit method does not do the actual submission, but rather prepares the data for submission.

Also, note that submission does not mutate the form, it simply creates a list of parameters suitable for creating the body of a post request.

Method redirect

redirect( self )

Returns the URL to which the response redirected, if any.

Method forms

Method POST

POST( self, url, data=None, mimetype=None, fields=None, attach=None, headers=None )

Posts the given data (as urlencoded string), or fields as list of (name, value) pairs and/or attachments as list of (name, value, type) triples. Headers attributes are the same as for the @GET method.

The @attach parameter is quite special, as the value will depend on the type: if type is @FILEATTACHMENT, then value is simply the path to the file, but if the type is @CONTENTATTACHMENT, the value is expected to be a triple (filename, mimetype, value).

Module scrape

The scraping module gives a set of functionalities to manipulate HTML data. All functions are text oriented, so that they work with any subset of an HTML document. This is very useful, as it does not require the HTML to be well-formed, and allows easy selection of HTML fragments.

SRE_Pattern

Compiled regular expression objects

Class Form

A simple interface to forms, returned by the scraper. Forms can be easily filled and their values (@values) can be given as parameters to the @browse module.

A form has:

  • a single action
  • a list of inputs which are dicts of equivalent HTML element attributes. For elements such as select or textarea, the input type property is set to the actual element type.
  • a list of values which will be associated with values when filling the form.

Form values are cleanly separated from their inputs, so that you can simply clear the values to resubmit the form.

Method hasId

hasId( self, name )

Tells if the element has the given id (case sensitive)

Method textlines

textlines( self, text, strip=True, empty=False )

Returns a list of lines for the given HTML text. Lines are stripped and empty lines are filtered out by default.

Class Transaction

A transaction encaspulates a request and its (zero or more) responses.

Attributes
  • session: enclosing session
  • request: request
  • data: data
  • cookies: cookies
  • redirect: for the redirection (None by default)
  • done: if the transaction was executed or not

Class HTTPClient

Sends and manages HTTP requests using the httplib and urlparse modules. Using the curlclient may be more efficient than using this one.

Class HTTPClient

Abstract class for an HTTPClient. As explained in the module documentation, the HTTPClient is a an object-oriented interface to low-level HTTP communication infrastructure. The HTTPClient is stateful, in the sense that it aggregates the status resulting from requests and responses.

Method list

list( self, contentOnly=False )

Returns a tag list from this Tree Node.

Method findNextTag

findNextTag( self, html, offset=0 )

Finds the next tag in the given HTML text from the given offset. This returns (tag type, tag name, tag start, attributes start, attributes end) and tag end or None.

int

int(x, base) -> integer

Convert a string or number to an integer, if possible. A floating point argument will be truncated towards zero (this does not include a string representation of a floating point number!) When converting a string, use the optional base. It is an error to supply a base when converting a non-string. If the argument is outside the integer range a long object will be returned instead.

Class Contract

A contract is like a unit test case, but for a website. Each contract has its own browsing session and scraping tools, which can be used by the various test methods.

Method _parseResponse

_parseResponse( self, message )

Parse the message, and return a list of responses and headers. This might occur when there is a provisional response in between, or when location are followed. The result is a list of (firstline, headers, body), all as unparsed stings.

Class TagTree

A tree node wraps one or two tags and allows to structure tags as a tree. The tree node instance offers a nice interface to manipulate the HTML document as a tree.

tuple

('http', 'https')

tuple() -> an empty tuple tuple(sequence) -> tuple initialized from sequence's items

If the argument is a tuple, the return value is the same object.

Method __init__

__init__( self, startTag=None, endTag=None, id=None )

TagTrees should be created by an HTMLTools, and not really directly. However, if you really want to create a tree yourself, use the startTag and endTags to specify start and end tags.

Method status

Method submit

submit( self, form, values={}, attach=[], action=None, method='POST', do=None, cookies=None, strip=True )

Submits the given form with the current values and action (first action by default) to the form action url, and doing a POST or GET with the resulting values (POST by default).

The submit method is a convenience wrapper that processes the given form and gives its values as parameters to the post method.

Module contracts

The contract module allows to express simple test case that allow to check particular responses. This enables easy verification of an API, as well as detection of modfications of an existing website API.

Method parameters

parameters( self )

Returns a list of (key,value) respecting the original input order.
